description: Published chemotaxis index (CI) values from C. elegans literature for validating simulated agent behavior

sources.notes: Classic study establishing chemotaxis assay paradigm for C. elegans. Diacetyl is a volatile attractant detected by AWA neurons.

sources.conditions: OP50 E. coli bacterial lawn, standard NGM plates, 20°C
sources.notes: Food-seeking behavior toward bacterial food source. Most relevant to our foraging simulation.
Salt chemotaxis, mediated by ASE neurons. Shows experience-dependent modulation.

sources.citation: Pierce-Shimomura et al. (1999). Journal of Neuroscience 19(21):9557-9569
sources.conditions: Radial gradient assay with bacterial food
sources.notes: Describes biased random walk strategy for navigation up gradients.
Benzaldehyde is another AWC-sensed volatile attractant.

validation_thresholds.notes: Thresholds based on typical CI ranges in literature. Minimum (0.4) indicates weak but detectable chemotaxis. Target (0.6) represents moderate attraction comparable to some mutant strains. Excellent (0.75) matches wild-type performance.

methodology.attractant_zone: Region within specified radius of food source

interpretation.ci_0.0: No preference (equal time in both zones)
interpretation.ci_-1.0: Perfect avoidance (all time away from food)
